reviews.review: Ta piola para viciar una noche, pero a la larga aburre mucho.

one of the best games i have ever played <3

It's Counter Strike but with missions and objectives. I used to play this a lot when i was a kid. Hard Bots were really difficult to deal with until you got any semblence of a "working" team. Most of the time I was all alone vs a full team of terrorists....
Had fun though, especially with the missions.

Literally i just use this game to lift. I do single player, max difficulty, set up a custom team and i do my sets knowing full well that if i take to long the game will pause between rounds automatically. I love Counter-Strike, and i love Condition Zero. Thanks for helping me get stronger. I won't forget you when i get huge!

cs condition zero deleted scenes is the only good counter strike game

what other counter strike game has, UNMODDED: literal porn, extremely questionable accents for all speaking characters, an end of evangelion poster, tons of bizarre easter eggs, segments taken straight from MGS1 and 2, some of the accidentally funniest setpieces i've seen in a video game, slapstick cartoon credits

[i]*Since this is a remaster to Counter-Strike and I feel like some of what I have said on the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/ciocolici/recommended/10?snr=1_5_9__402]review for that game[/url] applies here as well, I am going to quote that stuff here. Afterwards I am going to write how I feel about what the remaster brings new, and of course also about Deleted Scenes.[/i]

[quote]Counter-Strike used to be my curse and my primary hobby. I have thousands upon thousands of hours spent in this game. So many nights... I had a dozen of Steam accounts created only to play CS on a (now dead) platform called PlayZeek, which was kind of what FaceIT is for CS:GO. This game represents my childhood and when I say CS all I think about is nostalgia.

CS's middlename is ESports, and it would not be an understatement if we would say that ESports wouldn't be today what it is, without this game. This game's ESports has died, obviously, but the game's community did not. Which is mindblowing. You don't have an issue finding a server with players at any given time, night or day. For a game so old it's wow. So if you're nostalgic and want to get back into this game, you won't have one problem, even after all this time. 

But for someone that has never played this before.. it is hard, it takes thousands of hours to learn the recoil and gameplay, has not aged well, looks ugly and the gameplay can probably only be understood and enjoyed by people that have understood and enjoyed it at its time. 

Going back to the game for a little bit of time was something unique. The feels, the nostalgia, the sounds, the gameplay, everything sends me back to my childhood, to a time without adult issues and only free time to waste (or spend) playing CS and dreaming of becoming the best. And expected to start the game, join a server, die instantly and then leave. But it actually made me play more. And I actually started to enjoy it. But I also understood the reasons why I would never come back to the game. What I have once seen as masterpiece, I now see as old gameplay. I still find it fun, to a point, I just can't see it with the same eyes I once did. 

This is a relic, a masterpiece for its time. To a point it can still be for most people that have used to play it at that time. I think updating the graphics to today standards, and maybe meddling a little bit with the gameplay, would make this game appeal to new people. The fact that this game has never died after sooooo many years, and it still has such an alive playerbase, says a lot. Normally I would suggest you play CS:GO instead of this, but I see them as totally different games, for probably different players. This one requires way more skill and it is way more punishing. What this game needs is the same gameplay and feel, but with today visuals. CS:CO (Classic Offensive) is more fitting to suggest here, but unfortunately, at the time writing this, it is still in development.[/quote]

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero has always been, for me, the better-looking same Counter-Strike that nobody likes. And that's what it is to a degree. It looks a little better, has other sounds, some new stuff like singleplayer with bots and that's all. It is Valve's attempt to remaster it. Most players did not move to it, neither did the CS pro scene. I, for one, now after trying it again, like them both, but prefer the original. They both have pros and cons, but in the end they're both the same game. I see it only about preference and taste. I like the original more than this. CZ also has way tinier playerbase since forever, and while in CS I had no issues finding servers with players to play on, in CZ I struggled to find what I was looking for: anything not DM. And those that I found were using the original CS maps and models and stuff, I did not even feel like playing CZ. But there still are players playing, which really is something to applaud. 

There's then Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes. If CZ was an attempt to remaster the original, CZ DS is an attempt to make a campaign with story and all. And, although many were okay-ish with it, for me it was a disaster. Did only enjoy it because it was CS gameplay, other than that... boring, boring and... boring. Story is there like it isn't, and it's just like... the way the original CS works gameplaywise, movementwise and so on, it does not work as a singleplayer campaign. And this is a weird statement, since the same movement system is present in Half-Life, and dozens of mods of Half-Life, but that's how I felt. Boring and uninteresting. There are so many mods that use Half-Life and look & play one thousand times better than this wannabe game. 

So CZ is a yes, if you find it better than the original, but CZ DS is a big no, it should not have been made in the first place.
overall its a great game and more decorated than (cs) 1.6 but the AI is extremely good xD.
Very cool game. Not too new and not too old

Useful if you want to try out some classic CS without having to go through community servers. The campaign challenges are also fun. I swear the bots have personalities of their own

To make the game even remotely playable though, you will first need to set up custom keybinds and fastswitch

It is still difficult to find good servers and Anti-Cheat Filter does not work.

CSGO is better at this moment
